author: andschwa
body: Resolves #914. The [`PSReadLine/PSReadLine`](https://github.com/lzybkr/PSReadLine/tree/master/PSReadLine) subtree was imported to `src/PSReadLine`, and then @palladia's changes to the private fork of PSReadLine were applied on top. I added the `project.json` file necessary to build PSReadLine on Linux, as well as the (slightly modified) module files. PSReadLine is now built with PowerShell and imported by default (though the keybindings are not set, so it's not used until enabled). I also had to disable more snap-in code, thanks @lzybkr for the help. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/powershell/powershell/917)

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I did the import as a squash because we do not intend to keep the PSReadLine source around after GA. Once public, we will export the changes to the PSReadLine repository, and then take a simple package dependency.

comments.author: palladia
comments.body: File placement seems weird, and it doesn't build dll on my system.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I did a rebase for a fixup commit and forgot `-p`, which, with a subtree merge, is necessary. I see what happened.

comments.author: palladia
comments.body:
There is a PSReadLine.psd1 in src/Modules/PSReadLine and in src/PSReadLine, and they differ.  The version in src/Microsoft.PowerShell.CoreConsoleHost/bin/Linux/netcoreapp1.0/ubuntu.14.04-x64/Modules/PSReadLine is copied from src/Modules/PSReadLine, I presume?  

I just worry that the two versions will go out-of-sync, like it already has.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: All right, I'm re-doing the import to move everything to `src/Microsoft.PowerShell.PSReadLine`.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: While re-doing the import, I'm doing it more correctly. I am eschewing the `git subtree` magic for actual Git [subtree merging](https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/howto/using-merge-subtree.html), such that we don't have rebase problems.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @palladia Do you sign off on the import?
